body.p:
Metcalfe County Ky
April 24th 1865
To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlette Governor of the State of Kentucky I hereby respectfully beg leave to inform you that I attempted to arrest Richard Williams, the man that killed Neal on the 4th day of Feb 1865 and failed from the following reasons I went to Indianapolis Ind and found that he had Substituted,, giving his proper name place of Residence &c has since as you will find been transfered from the 6th Cong Dist Ind and assigned to the 33 Reg Ind Vols after learning this I was reccommended to Governor Morton he being absent I saw his Sect and his advise was for you to make a recquisitiion for his delivery to our State and as your humble Servant beg you as our chief magistrate to promptly attend to it N, B. the 33 Ind vols. are at
Wilmington, N, C, please do us the honor and favor to inform us what action has been taken upon the part of your excellency and what will be my further duty to have him delivered to our civil authorities as I have undertaken the matter

Permit us to Remain Respectfuly
Your most obedient Servt
A. C. Schlenker

To his his Excellency Thomas E Bramblet Governor of Ky I would say to you that I am well acquainted with Mr Shinker & that he is all wright & a gentleman & I would be glad that you would do some^thing^ in this case if you can

John Y Wallace
Judge of the Metcalfe County Court
County Cort
